citation.article-title: Vibrio scophthalmi sp. nov., a new species from turbot (Scophthalmus maximus).

p.s: Description of Vibrio scophthalmi sp. nov.
Vibrio scophthalmi (scoph. thal' mi. L. gen. n. scophthalmi, of turbot [Scophthalmus maximus])
Grows on thiosulfate- citrate-bile salts-sucrose agar, producing yellow colonies, and does not grow on VAM.
Both oxidative metabolism and fermentative metabolism occur.
Oxidase and catalase tests are positive.
Sensitive to vibriostatic agent 0/129 (10 or 150 μg per disc) and does not produce gas from glucose. V. scophthalmi cannot grow at 4,37, or 40°C, but grows well at 22 and 30°C.
It grows weakly in culture media supplemented with 0.5% (wt/vol) NaCl and does not grow when NaCl is absent.
The optimal NaCl concentration for growth is 1 to 3% (wt/vol), and it does not grow at higher NaCl concentrations (6, 8, 10%).
Additional properties are showed in Tables 1 and 2. V. scophthalmi has a G+C content of 44 to 45.5 mol%.
Strain A089 is the type strain of V. scophthalmi.
It has biochemical and molecular characteristics described above.
The G+C content of its DNA is 45.3 mol%, and it has a Tm of 69.7°C in 0.1 x SSC (1 x SSC is 0.15 M NaCl plus 0.015 M sodium citrate).
Strain A089T has been deposited in the Colección Espaiiola de Cultivos Tipo, València, Spain, as strain CECT 4638T.
